intro: Chailletia timoriensis, commonly known as the Timor chailletia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and pink. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
